intro: Schizocodon soldanelloides f. albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflowered schizocodon, is a rare variant of the Schizocodon soldanelloides species. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive white flowers, which contrast with the typical pink or red hues of the species. It is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral characteristics, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
